column93: May 12 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Verizon Communications Inc.'s  (Verizon; NYSE: VZ) Issuer Default Ratings (IDRs) and debt ratings following its  announcement that it has reached an agreement to purchase AOL Inc. (AOL) for $50  per share
column94: or approximately $4.4 billion. The ratings have been affirmed as follows: Verizon Communications Inc. --Long-term IDR at 'A-'; --Senior unsecured debt at 'A-'; --Senior unsecured revoUS STOCKS-Global bond worries push Wall Street lowerUS STOCKS-Wall St cuts losses as global bond worries weighDeals of the day-Mergers and acquisitionsUPDATE 7-Verizon to buy AOL in $4.4 bln mobile video pushUS STOCKS-Wall St ends weaker as global bond worries deepenVerizon to buy AOL in $4.4 billion mobile video pushAOL's Armstrong charted bumpy path to big Verizon sale May 12 AOL Inc Chief Executive Tim Armstrong's six year path to transforming the venerable dial-up Internet provider into a marketable mobile ad specialist was filled with bumps.  AOL's Armstrong charted bumpy path to big Verizon sale May 12 AOL Inc Chief Executive Tim Armstrong's six year path to transforming the venerable dial-up Internet provider into a marketable mobile ad specialist was filled with bumps. Verizon Communications Inc  is buying AOL Inc  in a $4.4 billion bet that a push into mobile video and targeted advertising can help the biggest U.S. telecommunications company find new growth avenues. | AOL's Armstrong charted bumpy path to big Verizon sale May 12 AOL Inc Chief Executive Tim Armstrong's six year path to transforming the venerable dial-up Internet provider into a marketable mobile ad specialist was filled with bumps.
